intro: Chrysanthemum reboudianum, commonly known as the Himalayan chrysanthemum, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is also cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant in temperate climates.
